title: CRISPR element detector
description: This feature specifically detects CRISPR (Clustered Regularly Interspaced Short Palindromic Repeats) elements in bacterial genomes. It shows strong activation directly at or immediately adjacent to CRISPR repeats and spacers, which are core components of bacterial adaptive immunity. The feature appears to recognize the characteristic sequence patterns or structural properties of CRISPR arrays. These elements function as a bacterial defense system against phage infection and other foreign genetic material. The pattern is highly consistent across multiple examples and is particularly prominent in Geovibrio thiophilus, though it appears in other bacterial taxa as well. This suggests the feature identifies a conserved aspect of CRISPR elements across diverse bacterial lineages.
